page.title: 06West Bay's Harbour Master
page.content:
The harbour is administered by a full-time Harbour Master, Mr. Hamblett, an ex-fisherman, on behalf of West Dorset District Council. His job is that of a policeman, ensuring that the bye-laws are kept and that crimes are not committed, perhaps the most serious being an attempt to bring unquarantined animals through this quiet back door.
He is responsible for moorings and launchings, cargo dues and licences. There is a waiting list of 80 for a mooring in the Harbour. The cost for a craft over eight metres is Â£213 per summer.
